contentheadline.headline: Forged from the Love of Liberty

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox anthem |title = Forged from the Love of Liberty |image = Trinidad and Tobago OnEarth WMS.png |image_size = |border = |caption = |prefix = National |country = {{TTO}} |author = [[Patrick Castagne]] |lyrics_date = 1962 |composer = [[Patrick Castagne]] |music_date = 1962 |adopted = 1962 by Trinidad and Tobago }} "'''Forged from the Love of Liberty'''" is the [[national anthem]] of the [[Trinidad and Tobago|Republic of Trinidad and Tobago]]. Originally composed as the national anthem for the short-lived [[West Indies Federation]] (1958-1962), this song was adopted by [[Trinidad and Tobago]] when it became independent in 1962.<ref>{{Citation | title = Understanding our national anthem | publisher = FIRST Magazine | year = 2012 | url = http://www.firstmagazine.com/DownloadSpecialistPublicationDetail.647.ashx}}</ref> ==Lyrics== Words and music by [[Patrick Castagne]] (1916-2000).<ref>{{cite web | url= http://www.ttembassy.org/?page=national-songs | publisher = Embassy of the Republic of Trinidad and Tobago | title = National Songs | accessdate = 17 June 2013}}</ref> :Forged from the love of liberty :In the fires of hope and prayer :With boundless faith in our destiny :We solemnly declare: :Side by side we stand :Islands of the blue Caribbean sea, :This our native land :We pledge our lives to thee. :Here every creed and race find an equal place, :And may God bless our nation :Here every creed and race find an equal place, :And may God bless our nation. == References == {{Reflist}} {{National Anthems of North America}} {{Nationalanthemsofthecaribbeanislands}} [[Category:National anthems]] [[Category:National symbols of Trinidad and Tobago]] [[Category:Trinidad and Tobago music]] [[Category:1962 introductions]] [[Category:West Indies Federation]]
